key_title: Key to the genera of Loganiaceae

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons

source.author: Conn, B.J.
source.title: Loganiaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Conn, B.J. (1999). Loganiaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Small trees, shrubs or semi-woody herbs; style 1; sepals, petals and stamens each 5; capsule septicidal, lacking distal horns
Herbs; styles 2, separate at base (fused distally) or separate throughout; sepals, petals and stamens each 4; capsule loculicidal, 2-horned distally
Stamens inserted on the corolla tube, distinctly below the sinus between the lobes; calyx lobes obtuse; flowers unisexual; erect leafy shrubs
Stamens inserted in the sinus between corolla lobes; calyx lobes acute; flowers bisexual; subshrubs, either more or less leafless and erect, or leafy and procumbent or trailing
Calyx absent; corolla enclosed in a 2-lobed foliaceous involucre (appearing like a 2-lobed calyx)
Calyx with sepals fused into cupular, campanulate or cylindric tube, with all lobes similar
Calyx with very short tube, with lobes dimorphic
